content: this is a summary of a civil case that took place in the vilnius regional district court the case involves a matrimonial property dispute between two parties referred to as db and rb the applicant db incurred professional fees of €365644 the movable property involved includes nonresidential premises administrative premises a treatment room a plot of land a dwelling house an outbuilding and various movable items such as audio equipment furniture baths solar panels and a coin collection several paintings are also involved the court decided to award db the nonresidential premises and administrative premises as personal ownership rb was ordered to keep the movable property in the dwelling house including audio equipment furniture baths and solar panels rb was also ordered to keep the coin collection the court declared that certain paintings are the personal property of db but one painting was recognized as the personal property of rb and another painting as the personal property of a different party db was ordered to pay rb compensation of eur 4376793 the text discusses various articles from the civil code related to matrimonial property including aspects of the statutory matrimonial property regime joint matrimonial property personal property of spouses grounds for terminating the matrimonial community property methods for dividing property shares of matrimonial property and determination of asset value the court has decided to dissolve the marriage between db and rb due to fault on both sides db has been awarded ownership of nonresidential premises and a treatment room while rb has been awarded a plot of land with a dwelling house and outbuilding rb has been ordered to keep the movable property in the dwelling house including audio equipment furniture and baths as well as solar panels rb has also been allowed to keep their coin collection the court has declared a specific painting as the personal property of db several other paintings were awarded to db as compensation db has been ordered to pay rb compensation and cover the costs of the proceedings the state has also been ordered to pay rb and db for the costs of sending procedural documents
